name: President Hotel

reviews.title: Avoid
reviews.text: This hotel is dated and the rooms are unclean-avoid.

As others have said, the President Hotel is a real throwback to the Communist era. From the outside it looks just like you would imagine a 1970s hotel to look like. Your hopes are raised by going into the lobby but these are soon dashed when you get to your room.
reviews.title: The hotel that time forgot...

reviews.text: Rooms are dark, really dated (but not in a shabby chic sort of way), with inadequate storage space, no safety box and a really basic bathroom. It was clean but not somehere you would want to spend much time in.
reviews.title: The President Kiev

reviews.text: Breakfast (which was included) was dreadful with lots of tasteless stodge and greasy cooked items. Service also poor - the staff in the bar have turned surliness into an art form! A waiter at breakfast inadvertantly dropped a knife on my leg - no apology offered even when I picked up the knife from the floor.
reviews.title: 1970's Shabby Chic at best

reviews.text: This is truly a terrible hotel mainly because the rooms are really dirty and have decor and furniture left over from the 70s. Also the room I had , had no security locks, water was brown at times, A/C did not work and windows did not open !. At $190USD per night , I was shoicked at how bad this place is. Generally some nice staff but overalll I would say service in the restaurants was poor with one waiter trying to convince me I could not put my meal on my room and had to pay cash - enough said.....Avoid at all costs!!!
reviews.title: Hum-drum former Intourist hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is bang opposite the conference centre which was very convenient to us as we participated in an event there. Rooms are smallish and not very fancy but you will have what you need, including a small fridge, small balcony, good bathroom with hot shower, bidet and very effective and quiet (!) air-conditioning. Breakfast was nice, buffet is not big but everything is fresh and the cotto ham was just delicious. Great coffee, friendly staff, very effective housekeeping. Free wifi with good connection (could download my newspaper without problems). Parking is difficult but the hotel has a garage (extra cost), make sure you tell them when you do not use it, otherwise they will charge for it. No pool but the beach is not far. No restaurant for the evening but plenty of good places around. Restaurant next door has great pizza.
reviews.title: Nothing fancy but ok

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights at the President in April with friends. The 'public' part of the hotel, the lobby and breakfast areas were lovely, and gave a real feel of what the hotel would have been like in its heyday. Upstairs, the rooms were tired but clean and serviceable. Renovation/decoration seems to have been started from the top floor down, we were on 4th floor.
reviews.title: Friendly, welcoming, and great value for money
Not Bad
reviews.text: Breakfast was plentiful with a good choice and included in the price. Staff were helpful and friendly.
We made a presentation for our Ukrainian colleagues at the big meeting
reviews.title: nothing to complain

reviews.text: room at President Hotel in Kyiv. We were invited to provide training
reviews.title: Old style but comfortable

reviews.text: course. President Hotel made our visit very nice and comfortable. The
reviews.title: avoid, a ripp off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a long week end to visit friends. As a young couple we just wanted to relax and be able to rest and catch up with friends.
reviews.title: Disappointing...

likes.liked: — The only reasonable part of the hotel was the swimming pool
likes.disliked: — The extremely rude and unhelpul attitude of the staff

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at 3am (as our flight was delayed) and we found a terribly arrogant front desk staff, we probably disturbed him from his nap.
reviews.title: Good deal, a bit dated

likes.liked: — Very well priced, spacious room, nice view

reviews.text: We were extremely tired and just wanted to go to our room, there was nobody to help with the luggage and there was no air-conditioning in the lifts or in the corridors.It was impossible to breath. We found our room to be a smoking room (even though I specifically asked for non-smoking) there was a strange smell in the room, the carpet was burned and stained and the air conditioning just managed to cool itself.The bathroom was clean but very basic. To our surprise in the morning we realised that from the bathroom we could hear clearly people next room talking and doing their business-there was no privacy.
reviews.title: Great value

likes.disliked: — I suppose the lifts were a little dodgy

reviews.text: Breakfast was a struggle with all the people just rushing for food, the quality of the food was vey poor (tinned fruit, flies all over the food and most of the tables were smoking tables).After having experienced this once we decided to have breakfast in the room for the remaining mornings (and we got charged 3 Euros for each time we requested this)
reviews.title: Rooftop pool

reviews.text: One very unfortunate incident happened when I went to use the toilets next to the restaurant and met the cleaning lady, she stopped me and asked where I was going, I explained and carried on walking, she started talking behind me and thought I didn't understand, and swore at me using a very nasty Greek work meaning the "f" word. I was speachless.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Overall this is a decent hotel in the heart of Athens, which provides a fair value for the money paid. One fatastic thing to point out is the lounge bar and pool at the top of the hotel. A splendid setting with great views of Athens, even though the service was a bit slow.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are a bit worn, and the wireless access did not work properly. As the hotel is frequented by a lot of tourist groups, the overall situation at the breakfast buffet can be a bit chaotic. Furthermore, the quality of the buffet is below average.
reviews.title: Only if you get a good price offer

reviews.text: The staff was friendly and efficient though.
reviews.title: Dissapointed in the President

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I don't consider it a good hotel, and I think it not worth the money (if you pay the internet price), I have been in this hotel more than 5 times due to its proximity to my business meeting point.
reviews.title: Marvelous Pool Roof Top - 21st Floor

likes.liked: — Their Pool lounge Bar & swimming pool

reviews.text: The first impression is that the hotel is really a 4 star one, but this changes as you get into the room or at breakfast:
reviews.title: don't stay at the President in Athens

likes.liked: — not clean, pool hours, breakfast, lack of ambiance

reviews.text: In July my family took a vacation to Greece from Beirut, Lebanon and during that time war broke out in Beirut. We were unable to return to Beirut and the President Hotel was extremely kind and caring in allowing us to stay on beyond our scheduled time, and constantly looked out for our well being,comfort, and safety.
reviews.title: Gracious Hospitality from Staff!!!

reviews.text: Nakos Christos( reception manager) and the front desk staff were most gracious and always available with their assistance. We were very pleased with our wonderful rooms, their service, and the food.
reviews.title: Still my home in Greece
It worked for us!
reviews.text: Our family would like to highly recommend this hotel, not only for it's location and spacious accomadations but also for the caring and gracious staff.

Stayed for 3 night for a business trip. Location is okay, close to center and subway(but never used that since company arranged taxi for me). Hotel seems spending all the money to decorate lobby. Lobby looks quite nice, but as soon as you go into the room, time goes back to 80s or maybe even earlier time. Furniture looks like at least 20 years old. TV is small and out of date.
reviews.title: Poor and over priced

reviews.text: Air con never seems to work, yes it works in certain way, but one can never set temperature lower than 18 degree, which makes the nights extremely difficult in summer. You are asked to turn off all electrifies including air con when you are out or the cleaning staff will do it for you if you didn't. One of my colleague found out all the chocolates melt on the desk when he went back from office.
reviews.title: Really Awful- avoid at all costs

reviews.text: No internet connection in the room, and paid internet connection is only available in lobby area. Breakfast is boring, service is okay. Mid night calls from stranger is quite annoying that I had to unplug telephone. Checking in and out is fast. Rate is more than 100 euro/night, and the value is poor for the money.
reviews.title: Renovated Soviet era Hotel
Avoid
reviews.text: Stayed here on a business trip for 2 nights. Lobby looks nice but as soon as you get to your room all you get is nasty floral dated decor and a bad smell. Bed was very lumpy and impossible to sleep in. Found the service quie bad also, seemed to be ignored a lot due to teh fact i wasn't a man!! There are many what look like high class call girls hanging around in the foyer so don't bother having a drink there!!! Avoid at all costs!

You can get older (cheapest) rooms or newly renovated (western standards - fair rates) rooms. Lobby and common areas are beautifully renovated. Don't be offended by the very "assertive" working girls in the lobby bar after 9pm.
reviews.title: Avoid Avoid Avoid

likes.liked: — watching the hookers solicit johns in the lobby
likes.disliked: — the room, the food, and the seedy environment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The President is a very good quality hotel. Our room was pleasant, a reasonable size, well-equipped and very comfortable. It had free wi-fi but lacked an electronic safe. The quality and range of the breakfast was the best we encountered in our tour of Ukraine and service was excellent. The only downside for us was that the hotel is located on a hill at the southern end of the city, so it is not convenient for the main tourist sights and the metro station to access them is a good 15 minutes walk away - down the steep hill and back again later, which was hard going in the 30+ degree heat of July/August.
reviews.title: Very good hotel but location poor for tourists

reviews.text: If in Ukraine stay in a apartment. Hotels are very over priced and this one was no exception. Tucked away from main road so it is about a 5-10 min walk to food, shopping etc..When you check in ask for one of the newly remodeled rooms. This would ensure you get a clean room that is more in tune with western standards. Standard rooms are very small. If you can afford it (about $400-$500 per night) upgrade to a suite. Everything else about this hotel is good, just way over priced. For a little more you can stay at the Hyatt. Or if you are on a budget rent an apartment. Way better value for the money.
reviews.title: Over priced!

reviews.text: But when you walk in the lobby you will think it is. The lobby is very nice, the staff was helpful and polite. The rooms however were terrible. I stayed on the fifth floor and the room was something out of a 1970's basement smoking den. The bathroom shower was installed about a foot off of the ground and was not of a high quality.
reviews.title: Not a four star hotel

reviews.text: It is worth noting that they are doing a lot of remodel work and the upper floors were not available to stay in during my stay. The bed was quite simply the worst I have ever slept on. It made noises when I blinked. There was working wireless internet and I had a good signal. I thought the breakfast was also very good. The hotel has hot water even though the city boilers were off.
reviews.title: "Average" sums it up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in a good location, only a few minutes walk to many restaurants and shopping. Hopefully after the remodel this will be a gem. I would not recommend at this time but I might change that upon the remodel.
reviews.title: Good value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. The service was good, there was free internet, it was conveniently located and it had historic old-world charm. I really liked the bolstered pillows on the bed! They were perfect for propping yourself up and watching TV. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was also very spacious (and clean). Plenty of hot water in the shower too. In room safe was greatly appreciated. We didn't try the restaurant, but the menu looked awesome! 2 complimentary bottles of water in the room for your refreshment.
reviews.title: Elegant & Updated

reviews.text: Located right next to the castle and the main square. Also near shopping and a 5 minute walk to the train station (7minutes with luggage).
reviews.title: Good hotel!

reviews.text: Air conditioning could have been a bit stronger, but we were comfortable enough.
reviews.title: Not quite presidential...

reviews.text: We'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: What a Grand Hotel!

description: The 4 star President Hotel is located in the city centre, on a picturesque hill, just 7 minutes walk from Khreschatik street, the main street of Kiev, 5 minutes from Olmpiysky stadium, Sports Palace, Central Synagogue.President Hotel offers comfortable rooms, Wellness Centre, multifunctional conference halls and several restaurants and two banquet halls.President Hotel offers 221 guest rooms:• 195 Executive Single/DoubleTwin Rooms (22 sq.m);• 20 Junior Suites (38 sq.m);• 5 Suites (60 sq.m);• 1 Apartment (82 sq.m)Room amenities include:- desk and working area;- luggage table;- minibar;- two line telephone;- non-allergic bed linen and pillows;- bottled water;- European-style bedding;- ergonomic desk chairs;- individual climate control system;- in-room safety-deposit box;- LCD TVsets with satellite television and interactive TV;- electronic room key;- black-out curtains;- robes & slippers;- hairdryer;- tea and coffee making facilities
